___eventbriteKeywords.description: If eventbrite.com is used, a list of keywords used to narrow the events to those specific to this group

___schedCom.description: If sched.com is used to help people choose sessions within big events, add an item per event here

___name.description: Conference name (seen in sched.com URLs as https://<conference_name>.sched.com)

___meetupComGroupName.description: If meetup.com is used for scheduling, the group name (seen in URLs as https://www.meetup.com/<meetupComGroupName>/

___facebookGroupName.description: If Facebook public groups are used for scheduling, the Facebook group name

___tla.description: Optional acronym used by the group, e.g. Boise Software Developers Group members always call themselves BSDG.

___eventbriteOrganizerId.description: If eventbrite.com is used for scheduling, the Eventbrite organizer ID (typically a number?)

___locality.description: Incorporated city/town where this group typically meets in-person, 'Online' if the group doesn't meet in-person, or 'Idaho' if no specific location

___description.description: Optional brief description of the group

___url.description: Optional (strongly encouraged) URL providing more information about the group, and ideally about the next meeting time & place

___addedDate.description: Date the group was added to this list, intended to help people find new groups. (ISO 8601 format)

___abandonedDate.description: If a group's no longer meeting, add this to record the last date it was known. This could be helpful in determining past interest, rather than deleting the group entirely. (ISO 8601 format)

___iCalendarUrl.description: If a generic web calendar is used for scheduling, its iCalendar/RFC5545 URL (e.g. the .ical URLs provided for public Google Calendars)
